channel.title: Permission issue with Redash version 10 beta
channel.description:
### Issue Summary
On V10 of redash, A user cannot view the query that belongs to another user even though they are in same group and the group has permissions to view_query. the "Edit Query" button is missing in this case. ![image|476x262](upload://zQVlKF7c3QqomLzrLxQeyZ3uCcr.png)
Current group permissions: {create_dashboard,create_query,edit_dashboard,edit_query,view_query,view_source,execute_query,list_users,schedule_query,list_dashboards,list_alerts,list_data_sources}
This issue did not exist in v8.
### Technical details:
* Redash Version: v10 * Browser/OS: chrome * How did you install Redash: upgraded from v8.

item.title: Permission issue with Redash version 10 beta
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Fix has been merged into master.

Read full topic

item.title: Permission issue with Redash version 10 beta
item.dc:creator: beti
item.description:
Meanwhile, here’s a little trick, type /source after the link of the desired query id and you’ll be able to view the query itself
Ex: bi.test/queries/10/source

Read full topic
item.source: Permission issue with Redash version 10 beta

item.title: Permission issue with Redash version 10 beta
item.dc:creator: dgho3174
item.description:
Issue Summary

On V10 of redash, A user cannot view the query that belongs to another user even though they are in same group and the group has permissions to view_query. the “Edit Query” button is missing in this case.

Current group permissions: {create_dashboard,create_query,edit_dashboard,edit_query,view_query,view_source,execute_query,list_users,schedule_query,list_dashboards,list_alerts,list_data_sources}

This issue did not exist in v8.

Technical details:

  • Redash Version: v10
  • Browser/OS: chrome
  • How did you install Redash: upgraded from v8.

Read full topic
